decodeAnimation.name: decodeAnimation
decodeAnimation.comment: Decode all of the frames from an animation. If the file is not an animation, a single frame animation is returned. If there was a problem decoding the file, null is returned.

decodeFrame.name: decodeFrame
decodeFrame.comment: Decode the frame (assuming image/image.PngDecoder.startDecode has already been called).

decodeImage.name: decodeImage
decodeImage.comment: Decode the file and extract a single image from it. If the file is animated, the specified image/image.PngDecoder.decodeImage.frame will be decoded. If there was a problem decoding the file, null is returned.

isValidFile.name: isValidFile
isValidFile.comment: Is the given file a valid PNG image?

numFrames.name: numFrames
numFrames.comment: The number of frames that can be decoded.

startDecode.name: startDecode
startDecode.comment: Start decoding the data as an animation sequence, but don't actually process the frames until they are requested with decodeFrame.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides image/image.PngDecoder.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and image/image.PngDecoder.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the image/image.PngDecoder.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

decodeAnimation.name: decodeAnimation
decodeAnimation.comment: Decode all of the frames from an animation. If the file is not an animation, a single frame animation is returned. If there was a problem decoding the file, null is returned.

decodeFrame.name: decodeFrame
decodeFrame.comment: Decode a single frame from the data that was set with image/image.PngDecoder.startDecode. If image/image.PngDecoder.decodeFrame.frame is out of the range of available frames, null is returned. Non animated image files will only have image/image.PngDecoder.decodeFrame.frame 0. An image/image.Image is returned, which provides the image, and top-left coordinates of the image, as animated frames may only occupy a subset of the canvas.

decodeHdrFrame.name: decodeHdrFrame
decodeHdrFrame.comment: Decode a single high dynamic range (HDR) frame from the data that was set with image/image.PngDecoder.startDecode. If the format of the file does not support HDR images, the regular image will be converted to an HDR image as (color / 255). If image/image.PngDecoder.decodeHdrFrame.frame is out of the range of available frames, null is returned. Non animated image files will only have image/image.PngDecoder.decodeHdrFrame.frame 0. An image/image.Image is returned, which provides the image, and top-left coordinates of the image, as animated frames may only occupy a subset of the canvas.

decodeHdrImage.name: decodeHdrImage
decodeHdrImage.comment: Decode the file and extract a single High Dynamic Range (HDR) image from it. HDR images are stored in floating-poing values. If the format of the file does not support HDR images, the regular image will be converted to an HDR image as (color / 255). If the file is animated, the specified image/image.PngDecoder.decodeHdrImage.frame will be decoded. If there was a problem decoding the file, null is returned.

decodeImage.name: decodeImage
decodeImage.comment: Decode the file and extract a single image from it. If the file is animated, the specified image/image.PngDecoder.decodeImage.frame will be decoded. If there was a problem decoding the file, null is returned.

isValidFile.name: isValidFile
isValidFile.comment: A light-weight function to test if the given file is able to be decoded by this Decoder.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
image/image.PngDecoder.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to image/image.PngDecoder.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If image/image.PngDecoder.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of image/image.PngDecoder.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

numFrames.name: numFrames
numFrames.comment: How many frames are available to be decoded. image/image.PngDecoder.startDecode should have been called first. Non animated image files will have a single frame.

startDecode.name: startDecode
startDecode.comment: Start decoding the data as an animation sequence, but don't actually process the frames until they are requested with decodeFrame.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
